summary: This bill, the "Educational Choice for Children Act of 2025," proposes to amend the Internal Revenue Code to offer a tax credit for charitable donations to organizations providing scholarships for qualified elementary and secondary education expenses. It defines eligible students, qualified expenses, and scholarship granting organizations, establishing requirements for the latter. The bill also includes provisions regarding organizational and parental autonomy, ensuring no governmental control over scholarship organizations, private schools, or parental scholarship use. Additionally, it specifies a volume cap on the tax credit and the effective date of the amendments.
